newsitem.title: CHILE: SOCCER-ROZENTAL CLOSE TO SIGNING FOR RANGERS, FATHER SAYS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ROZENTAL CLOSE TO SIGNING FOR RANGERS, FATHER SAYS.

text.p: Sebastian Rozental, one of Chile's top scorers, has almost clinched a $10 million transfer to Scottish club Glasgow Rangers with the deal expected to be signed this week, his father and manager Lazaro Rozental said on Wednesday.
"Only small things have to be agreed, like how long he stays there and where he will live," Lazaro Rozental told Las Ultimas Noticias newspaper after a trip to Britain.
Rozental's club Universidad Catolica could receive $6 million with the player getting $3.5 million for a three-and-a-half year contract, said the paper.
If the deal goes ahead, it will be the most expensive transfer in Chile's soccer history.
Rozental, 20, could leave for Scotland after Chile's World Cup qualifier against Argentina on December 15, his father said.
